rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's lesson is about creating structure for our children.

Rules and routines help children understand what is expected from them, be responsible, and stay safe. 

Children are more likely to follow rules if you create them TOGETHER. 

Creating daily routines (around for example meals, school and bedtime) will help your child feel safe, secure, and calm.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's lesson is about creating structure for our children.

Rules and routines help children understand what is expected from them, be responsible, and stay safe. 

Children are more likely to follow rules if you create them TOGETHER. 

Creating daily routines (around for example meals, school and bedtime) will help your child feel safe, secure, and calm.

media_title.eng: Parenting can be stressful, but rules can help make moments of your day more calm. Tap play to learn more

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

Do you have moments in the day with your child that feel stressful? Is it bedtime or getting ready for school?

Rules can help! Having clear rules and routines actually helps children know what is expected of them, which helps reduce the struggles of the more stressful moments in the day.

rows.media_title: Parenting can be stressful, but rules can help make moments of your day more calm. Tap play to learn more
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

Do you have moments in the day with your child that feel stressful? Is it bedtime or getting ready for school?

Rules can help! Having clear rules and routines actually helps children know what is expected of them, which helps reduce the struggles of the more stressful moments in the day.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s look at an example together. @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name is spending too much time watching TV before her homework is finished. @data.characters.f1_mother.name helps her create a family rule about this:

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s look at an example together. @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name is spending too much time watching TV before her homework is finished. @data.characters.f1_mother.name helps her create a family rule about this:

character_1_text.eng: It is important that you get your homework done so you can do well in school. Let’s make a rule about watching TV so that you have enough time for homework, too.”

rows.character_1_text: It is important that you get your homework done so you can do well in school. Let’s make a rule about watching TV so that you have enough time for homework, too.”
What do you think would be a fair rule?

character_1_text.eng: What do you think would be a fair rule?

character_2_text.eng: Hmmm…well, maybe I can watch TV as much as I want, but only after I do my homework?

rows.character_2_text: Hmmm…well, maybe I can watch TV as much as I want, but only after I do my homework?

rows.character_1_text: I like that idea, but let’s limit it to 30 minutes per day so that you have time for other fun and relaxing things too. How does that sound?

character_1_text.eng: I like that idea, but let’s limit it to 30 minutes per day so that you have time for other fun and relaxing things too. How does that sound?

rows.character_1_text: Thank you for doing your homework before watching TV, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name. Last night you mentioned that your math tests have become easier for you! I am proud of you! We can increase your time to an hour each day… as long as you still do your homework first!

character_1_text.eng: Thank you for doing your homework before watching TV, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name. Last night you mentioned that your math tests have become easier for you! I am proud of you! We can increase your time to an hour each day… as long as you still do your homework first!

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s reflect on how @data.characters.f1_mother.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name created a rule together.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s reflect on how @data.characters.f1_mother.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name created a rule together.

quiz_1_question.eng: Why does @data.characters.f1_mother.name ask @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name for her ideas on what the household rule should be?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Correct. When you make rules together with your child, the rules will work better.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: To make it more likely that she follows the rule

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Correct. When you make rules together with your child, the rules will work better.

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: To make her feel her ideas are valued

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Correct. When you make rules together with your child, the rules will work better.

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: To make sure she feels the rule is fair and realistic

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Correct. When you make rules together with your child, the rules will work better.

quiz_2_question.eng: What does @data.characters.f1_mother.name do when @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name follows the rule?

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Yes, by doing this @data.characters.f1_mother.name makes it more likely that @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name will keep following the rule about TV watching.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: She gives her a simple reward

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Yes, by doing this @data.characters.f1_mother.name makes it more likely that @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name will keep following the rules about TV watching.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s look at @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and her granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. They have set up a routine around bedtime that is working really well!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s look at @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and her granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. They have set up a routine around bedtime that is working really well!

character_1_text.eng: I am so happy to see you playing quietly with your building blocks, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. In 5 minutes, it will be time to get ready for bed. When you are ready for bed, we can read a story together.

rows.character_1_text: I am so happy to see you playing quietly with your building blocks, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. In 5 minutes, it will be time to get ready for bed. When you are ready for bed, we can read a story together.

character_1_text.eng: Time to get ready for bed, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. First, let’s get you nice and clean with a bath.

rows.character_1_text: Time to get ready for bed, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. First, let’s get you nice and clean with a bath.
You were so well-behaved in the bath, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. Now it is time to put your pyjamas on.

character_1_text.eng: You were so well-behaved in the bath, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. Now it is time to put your pyjamas on.

rows.character_1_text: Well done for putting on your pyjamas by yourself, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name! Now let’s brush your teeth. Make sure you get the ones in the back of your mouth too!

character_1_text.eng: Well done for putting on your pyjamas by yourself, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name! Now let’s brush your teeth. Make sure you get the ones in the back of your mouth too!

rows.character_1_text: You did so well getting ready for bed! Now, we have time to read a story. Which book would you like to read?

character_1_text.eng: You did so well getting ready for bed! Now, we have time to read a story. Which book would you like to read?

character_2_text.eng: Yay! Can you read me the story about the lion?

rows.character_2_text: Yay! Can you read me the story about the lion?

rows.character_1_text: The end….” I’m glad you chose that story for us to read, it’s one of my favourites! Goodnight, my dear. I love you very much.

character_1_text.eng: The end….” I’m glad you chose that story for us to read, it’s one of my favourites! Goodnight, my dear. I love you very much.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s think about what made this routine work well so we can all have peaceful bedtimes in our families.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s think about what made this routine work well so we can all have peaceful bedtimes in our families.

quiz_1_question.eng: How often do you think @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name follow this routine?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Try again. If @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name only do these steps once a week, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name would not be able to remember and follow the routine as well as she does here.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Try again. Following these steps only a few times a week may confuse @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name, and she may struggle to follow the routine as well as she does here.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng:
Exactly. Being consistent with a routine – especially at the end of the day when everyone is tired – makes activities easier to follow for children. 

With a bit of practice, bedtime can become a happy time of connecting with your child!

quiz_2_question.eng: What does @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name do to help @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name follow this routine?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: She praises and connects with @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name before giving instructions

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Yes, praise helps encourage @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name to follow the routine successfully.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: She promises @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name a simple reward to encourage her

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Yes, the promise of a reward helped @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name to follow the routine successfully.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: She gives @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name a transition warning for each step of the routine.

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Yes, knowing which step comes next helps @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name to follow the routine successfully.

quiz_2_option_4_text.eng: She gives @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name one instruction at a time.

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: Yes, one instruction at a time means @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name doesn’t get confused and helps her to follow the routine successfully.

quiz_2_feedback_5.eng: Yes, praise will help @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name to remember how to follow the routine successfully next time, and encourage her to follow the next step.

rows.quiz_1_question: How often do you think @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name follow this routine?

rows.text_1_facilitator: These four tips will help you create rules and routines to bring more structure and peace in your home.

text_1_facilitator.eng: These four tips will help you create rules and routines to bring more structure and peace in your home.

section_1_text.eng: When you involve your child in making rules they are more likely to follow them. One rule at a time is easiest.

section_1_extra_text.eng:
Plan rules WITH your child. Discuss the reasons for the rule and ask about their ideas.

Older children can share their own ideas of what they think the rule should be and you can agree together. They will feel appreciated and heard.

section_2_text.eng:
Consider your child’s age and developmental level when creating rules and routines. They have to be able to do what is expected of them.

Remember: Only introduce one new rule or routine at a time – you can add another one later.

section_2_extra_text.eng: Make rules and routines realistic for what your child can actually do, and specific so there is no misunderstanding. Don’t say “ “clean up” but “pick up all of your blocks”.

section_3_text.eng:
Make sure your child follows the rules and routines daily.

That way, your child knows what to expect and this will help them to feel secure. They will learn to be more independent and responsible.

section_3_extra_text.eng: Activities become easier when children learn and get used to a routine.

rows.section_1_text: When you involve your child in making rules they are more likely to follow them. One rule at a time is easiest.
rows.section_1_extra_text:
Plan rules WITH your child. Discuss the reasons for the rule and ask about their ideas.

Older children can share their own ideas of what they think the rule should be and you can agree together. They will feel appreciated and heard.
rows.section_2_text:
Consider your child’s age and developmental level when creating rules and routines. They have to be able to do what is expected of them.

Remember: Only introduce one new rule or routine at a time – you can add another one later.
rows.section_2_extra_text: Make rules and routines realistic for what your child can actually do, and specific so there is no misunderstanding. Don’t say “ “clean up” but “pick up all of your blocks”.
rows.section_3_text:
Make sure your child follows the rules and routines daily.

That way, your child knows what to expect and this will help them to feel secure. They will learn to be more independent and responsible.
rows.section_3_extra_text: Activities become easier when children learn and get used to a routine.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Now that you have learned some tips, let’s come up with ideas for rules and routines in your home.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Now that you have learned some tips, let’s come up with ideas for rules and routines in your home.

text_2.eng: Here are some of the rules and routines that other families created.

quiz_1_question.eng: Would you like to try one of these rules with your child?

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: Your child can play after finishing homework

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: This is a great rule! Discuss it with your child and family, or come up with a different rule that will help you at home.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: All family members eat dinner together

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: This is a great rule! Discuss it with your child and family, or come up with a different rule that will help you at home.

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: Your child helps to clear the dishes after dinner

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: This is a great rule! Discuss it with your child and family, or come up with a different rule that will help you at home.

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: Your child packs away the toys they played with during the day before bedtime

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: This is a great rule! Discuss it with your child and family, or come up with a different rule that will help you at home.

quiz_2_question.eng: In which of these areas would you like to create routines with your child?

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Wonderful! Give it a try and see how it will change your relationship with your child.

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Wonderful! Give it a try and see how it will change your relationship with your child. Remember bedtime routines work best when they are predictable and calm!

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Wonderful! Give it a try and see how it will change your relationship with your child. Remember to use positive instructions when setting up this routine.

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: Wonderful! Give it a try and see how it will change your relationship with your child. Remember that mealtime routines work best when they are predictable.

quiz_2_feedback_5.eng: Wonderful! Remember to praise for following through on chore routines! Give it a try and see how it will change your relationship with your child.

quiz_2_feedback_6.eng: Wonderful! Give it a try and see how it will change your relationship with your child.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Your home activity is to set *one* rule and *one* routine with your child this week. 

Remember to be realistic and consistent, and praise your child for following each rule or routine!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Your home activity is to set *one* rule and *one* routine with your child this week. 

Remember to be realistic and consistent, and praise your child for following each rule or routine!

media_title.eng: @data.characters.media_female_7.name learned that rules and consistency make a difference in her family. Tap play to hear more

media_transcript.eng:
Bedtime was always a struggle in our house. My children wanted to keep watching TV and I would always end up shouting at them: “Go to bed now! You know you have to be ready for school early in the morning!”. Some days I was just too tired, and I would let them watch more TV. 

When we learned in @global.app_name about rules, I learned that it is important to be consistent. I discussed with my children why watching TV till late is a problem, and we came up with a rule together to switch off the TV at 8 and be ready for bed by 8.30. Now everyone knows what is expected of them, and we can end the day peacefully.

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you set one routine and one rule with your child?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! I hope it makes your home feel easier to manage for everyone.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: You can do it! Setting rules and routines is hard in the beginning, but it becomes easier when you find a way that works for you.

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: That's okay. Setting rules is hard and including children can feel uncomfortable, especially if you’re not used to it. Keep trying until you find a way that works for you and your children. I promise, it will be worth it!

rows.media_title: @data.characters.media_female_7.name learned that rules and consistency make a difference in her family. Tap play to hear more
rows.media_transcript:
Bedtime was always a struggle in our house. My children wanted to keep watching TV and I would always end up shouting at them: “Go to bed now! You know you have to be ready for school early in the morning!”. Some days I was just too tired, and I would let them watch more TV. 

When we learned in @global.app_name about rules, I learned that it is important to be consistent. I discussed with my children why watching TV till late is a problem, and we came up with a rule together to switch off the TV at 8 and be ready for bed by 8.30. Now everyone knows what is expected of them, and we can end the day peacefully.
